FuncDef:
The peer-address command configures the peer address for a PW in the PW template.
The peer-address command deletes the peer address of a PW from the PW template.
By default, no peer address is configured for a PW.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of the remote peer on a PW.
The value is usually the LSR ID of the remote peer.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A PW template can simplify the configuration of PWs with similar attributes.
The peer attribute can be specified for a PW using the mpls l2vc or mpls static-l2vc command or a PW template. If it is specified using both a command and a PW template, the configuration made using the command prevails.
Prerequisites
MPLS L2VPN has been enabled.A PW template has been created.

Configuration Impact
After the peer address is specified in a PW template, the restart of the PW template may affect system operation.
Follow-up Procedure
Apply a configured PW template when creating an LDP or SVC VPWS connection on an interface.
Precautions
The peer address of a PW can be changed in real time. After the peer address in a PW template is changed, note the following:
If the PW template is not in use, it does not need to restart.If the PW template is in use, you must run the reset pw pw-template command for the new configuration to take effect. This, however, may disconnect and re-establish the PWs that apply the PW template. If multiple PWs use this template at the same time, the services take a long time to recover.
